   20: -module(fun_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          test1/1,overwritten_fun/1,otp_7202/1,bif_fun/1,
   25:          external/1,eep37/1,badarity/1,badfun/1,
   26:          duplicated_fun/1,unused_fun/1,parallel_scopes/1,
   27:          coverage/1,leaky_environment/1]).
   28: 
   29: %% Internal exports.
   30: -export([call_me/1,dup1/0,dup2/0]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: 
   34: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   35: 
   36: all() -> 
   37:     [{group,p}].
   38: 
   39: groups() ->
   40:     [{p,[parallel],
   41:       [test1,overwritten_fun,otp_7202,bif_fun,external,eep37,
   42:        badarity,badfun,duplicated_fun,unused_fun,
   43:        parallel_scopes,
   44:        coverage,leaky_environment]}].
   45: 
   46: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   47:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   48:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, int:interpreted()),
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: %%% The help functions below are copied from emulator:bs_construct_SUITE.
   61: 
   62: -define(T(B, L), {fun() -> B end(), ??B, L}).
   63: 
   64: l1() ->
   65:     [
   66:      ?T((begin _A = 3, F = fun(_A) -> 1; (_) -> 2 end, F(2) end), 1),
   67:      ?T((begin G = fun(1=0) -> ok end, {'EXIT',_} = (catch G(2)), ok end), ok),
   68:      ?T((begin F = fun(_, 1) -> 1; (F, N) -> N * F(F, N-1) end, F(F, 5) end), 120),
   69:      ?T((begin F = fun(_, 1) -> 1; (F, N) -> N * F(F, N-1) end, F(F, 1), ok end), ok)
   70:     ].
   71: 
   72: test1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73:     lists:foreach(fun one_test/1, eval_list(l1(), [])),
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: evaluate(Str, Vars) ->
   77:     {ok,Tokens,_} =
   78:         erl_scan:string(Str ++ " . "),
   79:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
   80:     case erl_eval:expr(Expr, Vars) of
   81:         {value, Result, _} ->
   82:             Result
   83:     end.
   84: 
   85: eval_list([], _Vars) ->
   86:     [];
   87: eval_list([{C_bin, Str, Bytes} | Rest], Vars) ->
   88:     case catch evaluate(Str, Vars) of
   89:         {'EXIT', Error} ->
   90:             io:format("Evaluation error: ~p, ~p, ~p~n", [Str, Vars, Error]),
   91:             exit(Error);
   92:         E_bin ->
   93:             [{C_bin, E_bin, Str, Bytes} | eval_list(Rest, Vars)]
   94:     end.
   95: 
   96: one_test({C, E, Str, Correct}) ->
   97:     io:format("  ~s, ~p~n", [Str, Correct]),
   98:     if
   99:         C == Correct ->
  100:             ok;
  101:         true ->
  102:             io:format("ERROR: Compiled: ~p. Expected ~p. Got ~p.~n",
  103:                       [Str, Correct, C]),
  104:             ct:fail(comp)
  105:     end,
  106:     if
  107:         E == Correct ->
  108:             ok;
  109:         true ->
  110:             io:format("ERROR: Interpreted: ~p. Expected ~p. Got ~p.~n",
  111:                       [Str, Correct, E]),
  112:             ct:fail(comp)
  113:     end.
  114: 
  115: -record(b, {c}).
  116: 
  117: %% OTP-7102. (Thanks to Simon Cornish.)
  118: 
  119: overwritten_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     {a2,a} = overwritten_fun_1(a),
  121:     {a2,{b,c}} = overwritten_fun_1(#b{c=c}),
  122:     one = overwritten_fun_1(#b{c=[]}),
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: overwritten_fun_1(A) ->
  126:     F = fun() ->
  127:                 {ok, A}
  128:         end,
  129:     if A#b.c == [] ->
  130:             one;
  131:        true ->
  132:             case F() of
  133:                 {ok, A2} ->
  134:                     {a2, A2};
  135:                 _ ->
  136:                     three
  137:             end
  138:     end.
  139: 
  140: %% OTP-7202. The liveness calculation for the make_fun2 instruction was wrong.
  141: 
  142: otp_7202(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  143:     otp_7202().
  144: 
  145: otp_7202() ->
  146:     List = [a],
  147:     Error = case otp_7202_func() of
  148:                 no_value -> true;
  149:                 {ok, V} -> V
  150:             end,
  151:     lists:foreach(fun(_E) ->
  152:                           case Error of
  153:                               true ->
  154:                                   ok;
  155:                               false ->
  156:                                   ok
  157:                           end
  158:                   end, List).
  159: 
  160: otp_7202_func() ->
  161:     no_value.
  162: 
  163: bif_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     F = fun abs/1,
  165:     5 = F(-5),
  166:     ok.
  167: 
  168: -define(APPLY(M, F, A), (fun(Fun) -> {ok,{a,b}} = Fun({a,b}) end)(fun M:F/A)).
  169: -define(APPLY2(M, F, A),
  170:         (fun(Map) ->
  171:                  Id = fun(I) -> I end,
  172:                  List = [x,y],
  173:                  List = Map(Id, List),
  174:                  {type,external} = erlang:fun_info(Map, type)
  175:          end)(fun M:F/A)).
  176: 
  177: external(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     Mod = id(?MODULE),
  179:     Func = id(call_me),
  180:     Arity = id(1),
  181: 
  182:     ?APPLY(?MODULE, call_me, 1),
  183:     ?APPLY(?MODULE, call_me, Arity),
  184:     ?APPLY(?MODULE, Func, 1),
  185:     ?APPLY(?MODULE, Func, Arity),
  186:     ?APPLY(Mod, call_me, 1),
  187:     ?APPLY(Mod, call_me, Arity),
  188:     ?APPLY(Mod, Func, 1),
  189:     ?APPLY(Mod, Func, Arity),
  190: 
  191:     ListsMod = id(lists),
  192:     ListsMap = id(map),
  193:     ListsArity = id(2),
  194: 
  195:     ?APPLY2(lists, map, 2),
  196:     ?APPLY2(lists, map, ListsArity),
  197:     ?APPLY2(lists, ListsMap, 2),
  198:     ?APPLY2(lists, ListsMap, ListsArity),
  199:     ?APPLY2(ListsMod, map, 2),
  200:     ?APPLY2(ListsMod, map, ListsArity),
  201:     ?APPLY2(ListsMod, ListsMap, 2),
  202:     ?APPLY2(ListsMod, ListsMap, ListsArity),
  203: 
  204:     42 = (fun erlang:abs/1)(-42),
  205:     42 = (id(fun erlang:abs/1))(-42),
  206:     42 = apply(fun erlang:abs/1, [-42]),
  207:     42 = apply(id(fun erlang:abs/1), [-42]),
  208:     6 = (fun lists:sum/1)([1,2,3]),
  209:     6 = (id(fun lists:sum/1))([1,2,3]),
  210: 
  211:     {'EXIT',{{badarity,_},_}} = (catch (fun lists:sum/1)(1, 2, 3)),
  212:     {'EXIT',{{badarity,_},_}} = (catch (id(fun lists:sum/1))(1, 2, 3)),
  213:     {'EXIT',{{badarity,_},_}} = (catch apply(fun lists:sum/1, [1,2,3])),
  214: 
  215:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch bad_external_fun()),
  216: 
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: call_me(I) ->
  220:     {ok,I}.
  221: 
  222: bad_external_fun() ->
  223:     V0 = idea,
  224:     fun V0:V0/V0,                               %Should fail.
  225:     never_reached.
  226: 
  227: %% Named funs.
  228: eep37(_Config) ->
  229:     eep37_basic(),
  230:     eep37_dup(),
  231:     eep37_gh6515(),
  232:     ok.
  233: 
  234: eep37_basic() ->
  235:     F = fun Fact(N) when N > 0 -> N * Fact(N - 1); Fact(0) -> 1 end,
  236:     Add = fun _(N) -> N + 1 end,
  237:     UnusedName = fun _BlackAdder(N) -> N + 42 end,
  238:     720 = F(6),
  239:     10 = Add(9),
  240:     50 = UnusedName(8),
  241:     ok.
  242: 
  243: eep37_dup() ->
  244:     dup1 = (dup1())(),
  245:     dup2 = (dup2())(),
  246:     ok.
  247: 
  248: dup1() ->
  249:     fun _F() -> dup1 end.
  250: 
  251: dup2() ->
  252:     fun _F() -> dup2 end.
  253: 
  254: eep37_gh6515() ->
  255:     {0,F1} = eep37_gh6515_1(),
  256:     F1 = F1(),
  257: 
  258:     [0,F2] = eep37_gh6515_2(),
  259:     1 = F2(0),
  260:     120 = F2(5),
  261: 
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: eep37_gh6515_1() ->
  265:     {case [] of
  266:          #{} ->
  267:              X = 0;
  268:          X ->
  269:              0
  270:      end,
  271:      fun X() ->
  272:              X
  273:      end}.
  274: 
  275: eep37_gh6515_2() ->
  276:     [case [] of
  277:          #{} ->
  278:              Fact = 0;
  279:          Fact ->
  280:              0
  281:      end,
  282:      fun Fact(N) when N > 0 ->
  283:              N * Fact(N - 1);
  284:          Fact(0) -> 1
  285:      end].
  286: 
  287: badarity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  288:     {'EXIT',{{badarity,{_,[]}},_}} = (catch (fun badarity/1)()),
  289:     {'EXIT',{{badarity,_},_}} = (catch fun() -> 42 end(0)),
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: badfun(_Config) ->
  293:     X = not_a_fun,
  294:     expect_badfun(42, catch 42()),
  295:     expect_badfun(42.0, catch 42.0(1)),
  296:     expect_badfun(X, catch X()),
  297:     expect_badfun(X, catch X(1)),
  298:     Len = length(atom_to_list(X)),
  299:     expect_badfun(Len, catch begin length(atom_to_list(X)) end(1)),
  300: 
  301:     expect_badfun(42, catch 42(put(?FUNCTION_NAME, yes))),
  302:     %% TODO: Investigate difference in behavior compared to compiler.
  303:     %% yes = erase(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  304: 
  305:     expect_badfun(X, catch X(put(?FUNCTION_NAME, of_course))),
  306:     %% TODO: Investigate difference in behavior compared to compiler.
  307:     %% of_course = erase(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  308: 
  309:     %% A literal as a Fun used to crash the code generator. This only happened
  310:     %% when type optimization had reduced `Fun` to a literal, hence the match.
  311:     Literal = fun(literal = Fun) ->
  312:                       Fun()
  313:               end,
  314:     expect_badfun(literal, catch Literal(literal)),
  315: 
  316:     ok.
  317: 
  318: expect_badfun(Term, Exit) ->
  319:     {'EXIT',{{badfun,Term},_}} = Exit.
  320: 
  321: duplicated_fun(_Config) ->
  322:     try
  323:         %% The following code used to crash the compiler before
  324:         %% v3_core:is_safe/1 was corrected to consider fun variables
  325:         %% unsafe.
  326:         id([print_result_paths_fun = fun duplicated_fun_helper/1]),
  327:         ct:error(should_fail)
  328:     catch
  329:         error:{badmatch,F} when is_function(F, 1) ->
  330:             ok
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: duplicated_fun_helper(_) ->
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: %% ERL-1166: beam_kernel_to_ssa would crash if a fun was unused.
  337: unused_fun(_Config) ->
  338:     _ = fun() -> ok end,
  339:     try id(ok) of
  340:         _ -> fun() -> ok end
  341:     catch _ -> ok end,
  342:     ok.
  343: 
  344: parallel_scopes(_Config) ->
  345:     1 = parallel_scopes_1a(),
  346:     1 = parallel_scopes_1b(),
  347:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,99},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_1c(),
  348: 
  349:     10 = parallel_scopes_2a(),
  350:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,15},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_2b(),
  351:     500 = parallel_scopes_2c(500, 500),
  352:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,1000},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_2c(500, 1000),
  353:     600 = parallel_scopes_2d(600, 600),
  354:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,1000},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_2d(600, 1000),
  355:     {a,20} = parallel_scopes_2e(20, 20),
  356:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,{a,25}},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_2e(20, 25),
  357: 
  358:     {[42,2],42,a} = parallel_scopes_3(a),
  359: 
  360:     42 = parallel_scopes_4a(id(42), id(42)),
  361:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,77},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_4a(42, 77),
  362:     42 = parallel_scopes_4b(id(42), id(42)),
  363:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,77},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_4b(42, 77),
  364:     [same,2,same,2] = parallel_scopes_4c(id(same), id(same)),
  365:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,55},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_4c(42, 55),
  366: 
  367:     33 = parallel_scopes_5(id(33), id(33)),
  368:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,44},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_5(33, 44),
  369: 
  370:     99 = parallel_scopes_6(id(99), id(99)),
  371:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,88},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_6(77, 88),
  372: 
  373:     99 = parallel_scopes_7(id(99), id(99)),
  374:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,88},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_7(77, 88),
  375: 
  376:     199 = parallel_scopes_8(id(199), id(199)),
  377:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,200},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_8(id(199), id(200)),
  378: 
  379:     {299,299+299} = parallel_scopes_9(id(299), id(299), id(299+299)),
  380:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,300},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_9(id(299), id(300), id(0)),
  381:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,0},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_9(id(299), id(299), id(0)),
  382: 
  383:     999 = parallel_scopes_10(false, 999, ignored, 999),
  384:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,999},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_10(false, 700, ignored, 700),
  385:     %% TODO: Investigate difference in behavior compared to compiler.
  386:     %% {'EXIT',{{badmatch,1000},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_10(false, 999, ignored, 1000),
  387:     999 = parallel_scopes_10(true, 999, 999, ignored),
  388:     333 = parallel_scopes_10(true, 333, 333, ignored),
  389:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,901},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_10(true, 900, 901, ignored),
  390: 
  391:     889 = parallel_scopes_11(889, 889, 889),
  392:     %% TODO: Investigate difference in behavior compared to compiler.
  393:     %% {'EXIT',{{badmatch,800},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_11(889, 800, 889),
  394:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,810},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_11(889, 889, 810),
  395:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,889},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_11(a, a, a),
  396: 
  397:     333 = parallel_scopes_12(333, 333, 333),
  398:     %% TODO: Investigate difference in behavior compared to compiler.
  399:     %% {'EXIT',{{badmatch,other},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_12(333, other, 333),
  400:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,nope},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_12(333, 333, nope),
  401: 
  402:     [1,100] = parallel_scopes_13(99, 100),
  403:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,no},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_13(no, 100),
  404:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,nope},_}} = catch parallel_scopes_13(99, nope),
  405: 
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: parallel_scopes_1a() ->
  409:     (begin X=1, true end
  410:      and
  411:      begin F=(fun () -> X=2 end), F(), true end) andalso X.
  412: 
  413: parallel_scopes_1b() ->
  414:     (begin X=1, true end
  415:      and
  416:      begin F=(fun () -> X=2 end), F(), true end) andalso (X = 1).
  417: 
  418: parallel_scopes_1c() ->
  419:     (begin X=1, true end
  420:      and
  421:      begin F=(fun () -> X=2 end), F(), true end) andalso (X = 99).
  422: 
  423: parallel_scopes_2a() ->
  424:     begin X=10, true end
  425:         and
  426:         begin F=(fun () -> X=20 end), F(), true end
  427:         and
  428:         begin X=10, true end andalso X.
  429: 
  430: parallel_scopes_2b() ->
  431:     begin X=10, true end
  432:         and
  433:         begin F=(fun () -> X=20 end), F(), true end
  434:         and
  435:         begin X=15, true end andalso X.
  436: 
  437: parallel_scopes_2c(A, B) ->
  438:     begin X=A, true end
  439:         and
  440:         begin F = (fun () -> X = make_ref() end), F(), true end
  441:         and
  442:         begin X=B, true end andalso X.
  443: 
  444: parallel_scopes_2d(A, B) ->
  445:     begin X=A, true end
  446:         and
  447:         begin F = (fun () -> X = make_ref() end), F(), true end
  448:         and
  449:         begin X=B, true end andalso (X = A).
  450: 
  451: parallel_scopes_2e(A, B) ->
  452:     begin X = {a,A}, true end
  453:         and
  454:         begin F=(fun () -> X = 20 end), F(), true end
  455:         and
  456:         begin X = {a,B}, true end andalso X.
  457: 
  458: parallel_scopes_3(A) ->
  459:     L = [X = id(42),
  460:          fun() -> X = 2 end()],
  461:     {L,X,A}.
  462: 
  463: parallel_scopes_4a(A, B) ->
  464:     4 = length([X = A,
  465:                 fun() -> X = 2 end(),
  466:                 X = B,
  467:                 fun() -> X = 2 end()]),
  468:     X.
  469: 
  470: parallel_scopes_4b(A, B) ->
  471:     4 = length([X = A,
  472:                 case id(true) of
  473:                     true ->
  474:                         fun() -> X = 2 end()
  475:                 end,
  476:                 X = B,
  477:                 case id(false) of
  478:                     false ->
  479:                         fun() -> X = 2 end()
  480:                 end]),
  481:     X.
  482: 
  483: parallel_scopes_4c(A, B) ->
  484:     [X = A,
  485:      fun() -> X = 2 end(),
  486:      X = B,
  487:      fun() -> X = 2 end()].
  488: 
  489: parallel_scopes_5(A, B) ->
  490:     4 = length([X = A,
  491:                 [fun() -> X = 2 end()],
  492:                 X = B |
  493:                 case id(false) of
  494:                     false ->
  495:                         [fun() -> X = 2 end()]
  496:                 end]),
  497:     X.
  498: 
  499: parallel_scopes_6(A, B) ->
  500:     4 = tuple_size({X = A,
  501:                     fun() -> X = 40 end(),
  502:                     X = B,
  503:                     fun() -> X = 50 end()}),
  504:     X.
  505: 
  506: parallel_scopes_7(A, B) ->
  507:     4 = tuple_size({X = A,
  508:                     [fun() -> X = 40 end()],
  509:                     X = B,
  510:                     [fun() -> X = 50 end()]}),
  511:     X.
  512: 
  513: parallel_scopes_8(A, B) ->
  514:     _ = [X = id(A),
  515:          begin fun() -> X = 2 end(), X = id(B) end],
  516:     X.
  517: 
  518: parallel_scopes_9(A, B, C) ->
  519:     3 = length([begin X = id(A), Y = id(A+B) end,
  520:                 fun() -> X = 2 end(),
  521:                 X = id(B)]),
  522:     {X,Y=C}.
  523: 
  524: parallel_scopes_10(Bool, A, B, C) ->
  525:     T = {X = A,
  526:          case id(Bool) of
  527:              true ->
  528:                  fun() -> X = 999 end(),
  529:                  X = B;
  530:              false ->
  531:                  X = C,
  532:                  fun() -> X = 999 end()
  533:          end},
  534:     2 = tuple_size(T),
  535:     X.
  536: 
  537: parallel_scopes_11(A, B, C) ->
  538:     T = {X = A,
  539:          case id(true) of
  540:              true ->
  541:                  X = B,
  542:                  2 = length([X = C, X = C]),
  543:                  fun() -> X = 889 end();
  544:              false ->
  545:                  X = cannot_happen
  546:          end},
  547:     2 = tuple_size(T),
  548:     X.
  549: 
  550: parallel_scopes_12(A, B, C) ->
  551:     T = {X = A,
  552:          case id(true) of
  553:              true ->
  554:                  fun() -> X = whatever end(),
  555:                  2 = length([X = B, X = B]),
  556:                  X = C;
  557:              false ->
  558:                  X = cannot_happen
  559:          end},
  560:     2 = tuple_size(T),
  561:     X.
  562: 
  563: parallel_scopes_13(A, B) ->
  564:     [X = 1,
  565:      fun() ->
  566:              X = id(whatever),
  567:              99 = A,
  568:              100 = B
  569:      end()].
  570: 
  571: coverage(_Config) ->
  572:     ok = coverage_1(),
  573: 
  574:     [2,3,4] = coverage_2(id([1,2,3])),
  575: 
  576:     {42,F} = coverage_3(id({[], x})),
  577:     x = F(),
  578: 
  579:     ok.
  580: 
  581: coverage_1() ->
  582:     %% Cover a line in beam_ssa_pre_codegen:need_frame_1/2 when the
  583:     %% no_make_fun3 option is given.
  584:     catch
  585:         fun(whatever) -> 0;
  586:            ("abc") -> party
  587:         end,
  588:         ok.
  589: 
  590: coverage_2(List) ->
  591:     %% Cover a line in beam_ssa_pre_codegen:need_frame_1/2 when the
  592:     %% no_make_fun3 option is given.
  593:     lists:map(fun(E) -> E + 1 end, List).
  594: 
  595: %% Cover a line in beam_block when no_make_fun3 option is given.
  596: coverage_3({[], A}) ->
  597:     {id(42), fun() -> A end}.
  598: 
  599: leaky_environment(_Config) ->
  600:     G = fun(X, Y) -> X + Y end,
  601:     F = fun(A) -> G(A, 0) end,
  602:     {'EXIT', {{badarity, {_, [1, flurb]}}, _}} = catch F(1, flurb),
  603:     ok.
  604: 
  605: id(I) ->
  606:     I.
